(50150, 52843).description: The upper layer of the Earth's surface, consisting of a mixture of mineral and organic matter, and supporting a wide range of ecosystems

(52326, 55508).name: biogeochemical cycles
(52326, 55508).label: ocean circulation
(52326, 55508).description: The processes by which elements such as carbon, nitrogen, and phosphorus are circulated between the environment and living organisms

(52326, 55508).name: carbon sequestration process
(52326, 55508).label: ocean circulation
(52326, 55508).description: The process by which carbon dioxide is removed from the atmosphere and stored in soils, oceans, or other carbon sinks

(52326, 55508).name: soil texture
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: The physical composition of soil, including the proportion of sand, silt, and clay particles

(52326, 55508).name: pH
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: A measure of the acidity or alkalinity of a solution, with a pH of 7 being neutral

(52326, 55508).name: temperature
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: A measure of the warmth or coolness of an environment

(52326, 55508).name: chemical fertilizers
(52326, 55508).label: instrument
(52326, 55508).description: Synthetic substances used to promote plant growth and fertility

(52326, 55508).name: denitrifying agent
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: A substance or microorganism that reduces nitrate to nitrogen gas, often involved in soil health and fertility

(52326, 55508).name: endophytic microbiome
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: The community of microorganisms that live within plant tissues, often involved in plant health and defense

(52326, 55508).name: metagenomics
(52326, 55508).label: instrument
(52326, 55508).description: The study of the genetic material of a community of microorganisms, often used to understand ecosystem function and diversity

(52326, 55508).name: meta-transcriptomics
(52326, 55508).label: instrument
(52326, 55508).description: The study of the complete set of RNA transcripts produced by a community of microorganisms, often used to understand ecosystem function and diversity

(52326, 55508).name: epigenomics
(52326, 55508).label: instrument
(52326, 55508).description: The study of the complete set of epigenetic modifications in a community of microorganisms, often used to understand ecosystem function and diversity

(52326, 55508).name: productivity
(52326, 55508).label: variable
(52326, 55508).description: The amount of output or yield produced by a system or process

(52326, 55508).name: sustainability
(52326, 55508).label: project
(52326, 55508).description: The ability of a system or process to be maintained or supported over time without depleting natural resources or harming the environment

(54960, 55789).name: density
(54960, 55789).label: variable
(54960, 55789).description: The amount of bacteria applied per unit area, influencing the impact of Bacillus subtilis on plant growth and soil health

(54960, 55789).name: soil
(54960, 55789).label: location
(54960, 55789).description: The upper layer of the Earth's surface, composed of mineral and organic matter, and supporting plant life

(54960, 55789).name: soil characteristics
(54960, 55789).label: variable
(54960, 55789).description: Properties of the soil, such as texture, pH, and nutrient content, that affect its fertility and interaction with microorganisms

(54960, 55789).name: sustainability
(54960, 55789).label: variable
(54960, 55789).description: The ability to maintain or support a process or system over time, in this case, referring to the long-term health and productivity of agricultural ecosystems
